metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12493 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: A stack-based buffer over-read exists in PostScriptFunction::transform in Function.cc in Xpdf 4.01.01 because GfxSeparationColorSpace and GfxDeviceNColorSpace mishandle tint transform functions. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftops tool. It might allow an attacker to cause Denial of Service or leak memory data.

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> as of 2022-01-05, xpdf commit not available. ebarretto> Marking emscripten ignored as poppler code is only for test/example. since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore. xpdf in Debian uses poppler, which is not affected or fixed

criterions.comment: emscripten: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
poppler: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
texlive-bin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
